info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montgomery County through 700 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mimosa, or 8 miles west of Mount Ida, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Ida... Norman... Oden... Mimosa... Mauldin... Black Springs... Pencil Bluff... Hurricane Grove... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
